data.reasoning: The menu for Great Wall Chinese Restaurant contains numerous ingredients and dishes that inherently contain gluten, such as soy sauce (used in virtually all stir-fries, fried rice, lo mein, etc.), wheat-based noodles (Lo Mein, Chow Fun), wheat flour coatings (Fried Chicken Wings, Egg Rolls, Dumplings, Wontons), and potentially malt vinegar or wheat-based thickeners. There is no explicit mention of gluten-free options, dedicated preparation areas, or staff training regarding celiac disease. The high volume of fried items and shared cooking surfaces (woks) poses a significant cross-contact risk. The absence of any positive safety indicators or allergen statements necessitates a high-risk rating for celiac disease.
risk_factors: Ubiquitous use of soy sauce (contains wheat) in standard Chinese cooking (Fried Rice, Lo Mein, Stir-fries).
Menu items use wheat noodles (Lo Mein, Chow Fun).
Appetizers (Egg Rolls, Wontons, Dumplings, Fried items) are typically made with wheat flour wrappers or batters.
No stated gluten-free menu or dedicated preparation protocols.
High risk of cross-contact due to shared woks, fryers, and utensils common in high-volume Chinese restaurants.
safe_alternatives: Steamed dishes (Healthy Choice Steamed Dishes D1-D6) *only* if the customer can confirm the sauce (usually brown sauce) served on the side is 100% gluten-free (e.g., thickened only with cornstarch, using tamari/GF soy sauce). This requires direct inquiry and confirmation.
Plain White Rice or Brown Rice, provided they are not cooked in contaminated woks.
